Package client

Class RestCommunicator

java.lang.Object
client.RestCommunicator
public class RestCommunicator extends Object
Class for communicating with the REST API. This class get's most of the information it's working on from the file Config/RestConfig.json
Version:
1.0
Author:
LeichtMatrosee

  • Field Details

    • host

      private String host
      The host the Rest API is running on. Localhost by default.

    • port

      private int port
      Port the Rest API is running on. 6000 by default.

    • baseUrl

      private String baseUrl
      Base URL of the Rest API. This is constructed on it's own.

    • cfg

      private org.json.JSONObject cfg
      JSON Object containing all information from the Config/RestConfig.json file.

  • Constructor Details

    • RestCommunicator

      public RestCommunicator() throws FileNotFoundException, IOException, org.json.JSONException
      Standard Constructor for the RestCommunicator. All information about Endpoints, host, port etc. is retrieved from the config file.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - Is thrown, whenever the config file could not be found.
      IOException - Gets thrown, when the Config file could not be read.
      org.json.JSONException - Gets thrown, when the config file could not be parsed into a JSON Object. Configuration is probably syntactically wrong.

  • Method Details

    • checkApiConnectivity

      public boolean checkApiConnectivity()
      Checks, whether the API is reachable by trying to retreive all lists from it. If connection ends in an Exception, the method returns false, otherwise it returns true.
      Returns:
      true, if API is reachable, false otherwise

    • drop

      public void drop()
      Drops the whole of the rest API.

    • sendHttpRequest

      public ResponseData sendHttpRequest(PostData p, String endpointName) throws IOException, URISyntaxException, InterruptedException, org.json.JSONException
      Wrapper Method for sending all http requests to the Rest API. First calls buildHttpRequest(PostData, String), which configures the request then sends it and parses the Response into a ResponseData object containing all inforation from the API response.
      Parameters:
      p - Contains all information, that is needed for the API Request.
      endpointName - Name of the endpoint as specified in the config file
      Returns:
      ResponseData object containing all the information from the API Response.
      Throws:
      IOException - Is thrown, when something went wrong.
      URISyntaxException - Is thrown, when the Syntax of the URL is incorrect.
      InterruptedException - Is thrown, when the connection with the API gets interrupted.
      org.json.JSONException - Is thrown, when body can't be build properly.

    • getEndPoint

      private org.json.JSONObject getEndPoint(String endpointName) throws org.json.JSONException
      Analyses the Config to find the endpoint with the given name and returns that.
      Parameters:
      endpointName - Name of the endpoint (set in config)
      Returns:
      JSONObject with all information about the found endpoint
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - Throws, when no endpoint with given name could be found

    • buildEnpointUrl

      private String buildEnpointUrl(org.json.JSONObject epCfg, PostData p) throws org.json.JSONException, IOException
      Builds the url of the endpoint by analysing the endpoint config (epCfg) and PostData (p). Iterates through array "plch" in config to replace all placeholders in endpoint url with the corresponding values from the PostData object. Iterates through the array "url" to set all url params. If a param in the config matches one of the PostData params, it gets added to the url as a param.
      Parameters:
      epCfg - Configuration of current endpoint
      p - Data to be posted
      Returns:
      Url of the endpoint
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - Gets thrown, whenever a key is trying to be accessed, that does not exist in the config
      IOException - Gets thrown, when a param in the config cannot be resolved to a field in PostData object

    • parseAttr

      private String parseAttr(String attr)
      Parses the attribute name so that it conforms with the Rest API. If listId is given, list_id is returned. If entryId is given, entry_id is returned.
      Parameters:
      attr - Name of the attribute to be parsed.
      Returns:
      Parsed name.

    • bodyBuilder

      private org.json.JSONObject bodyBuilder(PostData p, String entity, org.json.JSONObject epCfg) throws org.json.JSONException, IOException
      Builds the JSON Object for the Body for Post, Patch and Put requests. Checks the Endpoint config epCfg and puts all attributes from p into a JSONObject, that are defined in epCfg.params.body.
      Parameters:
      p - Object containing all data for the Post Request
      entity - Either "List" or "entry". Isn't really needed though.
      epCfg - Configuration of current endpoint
      Returns:
      JSONObject containing all key value pairs for the body of the post request
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - Is thrown, when a key in JSONObject is accessed, that does not exist
      IOException - is thrown, whenever something unexpected happens.

    • buildHttpRequest

      private HttpRequest buildHttpRequest(PostData p, String epName) throws org.json.JSONException, URISyntaxException, IOException
      Builds the HttpRequest Object for the Request, depending on the config. First calls getEndPoint(String) to retrieve the endpoint from the config, depending on epName. Then builds endpoint URL by calling buildEnpointUrl(JSONObject, PostData). Finally builds the HttpRequest. For Patch and post, the body is build by bodyBuilder(PostData, String, JSONObject).
      Parameters:
      p - Object containing all relevant information for the request
      epName - Name of the endpoint (must match endpoint in config)
      Returns:
      Complete HttpRequest object, that can be sent to API
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - Is thrown, when a key in JSONObject is accessed, that does not exist
      URISyntaxException - Is thrown, when the URI for the request is invalid (invalid characters in url and such)
      IOException - Is thrown, when no method or content type is found in config

    • buildBaseUrl

      public void buildBaseUrl()
      Builds the base url of the API, by concatanating the host and the port

    • setHost

      public void setHost(String host)
      Sets the host name to the given String and builds the Base URL anew, by calling buildBaseUrl().
      Parameters:
      host - Hostname or IP Adress

    • getHost

      public String getHost()
      Retrieves the current hostname.
      Returns:
      Current hostname.

    • setPort

      public void setPort(int port)
      Sets the port for the API and builds the Base URL anew, by calling buildBaseUrl().
      Parameters:
      port - New Port

    • getPort

      public int getPort()
      Retrieves the current port of the api.
      Returns:
      Current port the instance is communicating with.
